clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used as a diagnostic aid for evaluation of gastric acid secretory function

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Pentagastrin is indicated as a diagnostic aid for evaluation of gastric acid secretory function It is effective in testing for anacidity achlorhydria in patients with suspected pernicious anemia atrophic gastritis or gastric carcinoma It is also effective in determining the reduction in acid output after operations for peptic ulcer such as vagotomy or gastric resection
